org.fcrepo.common.rdf

Class JRDF

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.fcrepo.common.rdf.JRDF

  • public abstract class JRDF
extends Object
    Utility methods for working with JRDF.
    Author:
    Chris Wilper

    • Method Detail

      • sameNode

        public static boolean sameNode(org.jrdf.graph.Node n1,
               org.jrdf.graph.Node n2)
        Tells whether the given nodes are equivalent.

        Nodes are equivalent if they are both resources or both literals and they match according to the rules of those types.

        Parameters:
        n1 - first node.
        n2 - second node.
        Returns:
        true if equivalent, false otherwise.

      • sameResource

        public static boolean sameResource(org.jrdf.graph.URIReference u1,
                   org.jrdf.graph.URIReference u2)
        Tells whether the given resources are equivalent.

        Two resources are equivalent if their URIs match.

        Parameters:
        u1 - first resource.
        u2 - second resource.
        Returns:
        true if equivalent, false otherwise.

      • sameResource

        public static boolean sameResource(org.jrdf.graph.URIReference u1,
                   String u2)
        Tells whether the given resources are equivalent, with one given as a URI string.
        Parameters:
        u1 - first resource.
        u2 - second resource, given as a URI string.
        Returns:
        true if equivalent, false otherwise.

      • sameLiteral

        public static boolean sameLiteral(org.jrdf.graph.Literal l1,
                  org.jrdf.graph.Literal l2)
        Tells whether the given literals are equivalent.

        Two literals are equivalent if they have the same lexical value, language (which may be unspecified), and datatype (which may be unspecified).

        Parameters:
        l1 - first literal.
        l2 - second literal.
        Returns:
        true if equivalent, false otherwise.

      • sameLiteral

        public static boolean sameLiteral(org.jrdf.graph.Literal l1,
                  String l2,
                  URI type,
                  String lang)
        Tells whether the given literals are equivalent, with one given as a set of simple values.
        Parameters:
        l1 - first literal.
        l2 - second literal's lexical value.
        type - second literal's datatype URI string, if applicable.
        lang - second literal's language tag string, if applicable.
        Returns:
        true if equivalent, false otherwise.

      • sameSubject

        public static boolean sameSubject(org.jrdf.graph.SubjectNode s1,
                  org.jrdf.graph.SubjectNode s2)
        Tells whether the given subjects are equivalent.

        Two subjects are equivalent if they are both resources and they match according to the rules for resources.

        Parameters:
        s1 - first subject.
        s2 - second subject.
        Returns:
        true if equivalent, false otherwise.

      • sameSubject

        public static boolean sameSubject(org.jrdf.graph.SubjectNode s1,
                  String s2)
        Tells whether the given subjects are equivalent, with one given as a URI string.
        Parameters:
        s1 - first subject.
        s2 - second subject, given as a URI string.
        Returns:
        true if equivalent, false otherwise.

      • samePredicate

        public static boolean samePredicate(org.jrdf.graph.PredicateNode p1,
                    org.jrdf.graph.PredicateNode p2)
        Tells whether the given predicates are equivalent.

        Two predicates are equivalent if they match according to the rules for resources.

        Parameters:
        p1 - first predicate.
        p2 - second predicate.
        Returns:
        true if equivalent, false otherwise.

      • samePredicate

        public static boolean samePredicate(org.jrdf.graph.PredicateNode p1,
                    String p2)
        Tells whether the given predicates are equivalent, with one given as a URI string.
        Parameters:
        p1 - first predicate.
        p2 - second predicate, given as a URI string.
        Returns:
        true if equivalent, false otherwise.

      • sameObject

        public static boolean sameObject(org.jrdf.graph.ObjectNode o1,
                 org.jrdf.graph.ObjectNode o2)
        Tells whether the given objects are equivalent.

        Two objects are equivalent if they match according to the rules for nodes.

        Parameters:
        o1 - first object.
        o2 - second object.
        Returns:
        true if equivalent, false otherwise.

      • sameObject

        public static boolean sameObject(org.jrdf.graph.ObjectNode o1,
                 String o2,
                 boolean isLiteral,
                 URI type,
                 String lang)
        Tells whether the given objects are equivalent, with one given as a set of simple values.
        Parameters:
        o1 - first node.
        o2 - second node URI (if isLiteral is false) or lexical value (if isLiteral is true)
        isLiteral - whether the second node is a literal.
        type - second literal's datatype URI string, if applicable.
        lang - second literal's language tag string, if applicable.
        Returns:
        true if equivalent, false otherwise.
